item.title: Playground
item.description:
The Playground
Where one races to a red light,
The other races to a slide.
Where one must be on time,
The other pays no mind.
Where one clocks in,
The other clocks out.
Where one sits down,
The other jumps around.
Where one sees green,
The other sees shades.
Where one gets no rest,
The other one plays.
Where one must click a mouse,
The other is outside, in his own house.
Where one values financial security,
The other has a grasp of the imaginary.
Where one attracts stress,
The other lay awake in the beautiful mess.
Where one must depend on the ego,
The other doesn’t know why, but they must go.
Where ones boss is the time on the clock,
The other sees his ship, parked at the dock.
Where one sees a long day,
The other is has everything to say.
Where one races back to his place in bed.
The other dances with dragons inside of his head.
Where one wakes up and says “here we go again”
The other volunteers to play instead.
Where one doesn’t believe the words they say.
The other is not affected by the day.
Where one waits a few extra seconds to move.
The other one has nothing to prove.

item.title: Magicman
item.description:
There once was a magic man.
Touched souls across the land.
Lies? No, I saw it first hand.
I was one of the lucky ones.
He was there when I begun.
Not blood but brothers in arms.
Spectators of the animal farm.
The magic man sat down on his bike, agh I can hear it now.
Started that thing up to a thunderous sound.
There was magic in this, with foam in his Guinness. I was there, believe this.
The magic man spoke and the magic man would gesture.
“Take it easy” was the lecture.
Valedictorian of the school of hard knocks.
Back down and give up? The magic man would not.
Fire and rain, the magic man was no stranger to pain.

item.title: Floyd
item.description:
Floyd said it’s like two lost souls swimming in a fish bowl.
Year after year that was my soul.

Until that bowl transformed into an hour glass,
You can’t count on moments that passed.
In the past?

We all need a tree like the giving one.
At the end we stop where we begun.

Just thanks to breath and the vibrations around.
Open your eyes and taste the sound.

We live together and die alone.
Magic measuring tape and traffic cones.

item.title: The saga of the trees
item.description:
Where one stands
One also falls
Chopped down
The roots remain.
Does it stay the same when it grows back?
What is the it?
What is it?
Does the wind hit it different now?
What is it?
What about the colors and what does the shade smell like?
Sticks and stones at my base.
Come take a seat.
